context: The word 'tüdrukust' is an Estonian elative case form, derived from the root word 'tüdruk' (girl). The elative case (-st ending) indicates movement away from or origin from something. So 'tüdrukust' means 'from the girl' or can be used to mean 'about the girl' in certain contexts. It shows where an action originates from or what is being discussed as a topic.
